en.burns_subtitle: Cool the area and protect the skin
en.fractures_subtitle: Immobilize the area and seek help
en.burns_step_1: Cool the burn with cool (not cold) running water for 10-20 minutes.
en.burns_step_2: Do not apply ice or greasy substances like butter.
en.burns_step_3: Remove any tight items, like rings or belts, from the burned area.
en.burns_step_4: Cover the burn with a clean, non-stick bandage or cloth.
en.burns_step_6: Seek medical help if itâ€™s a deep, large, or facial burn.
en.cuts_and_bleeding_step_1: Wash your hands and wear gloves if available.
en.cuts_and_bleeding_step_2: Apply gentle pressure with a clean cloth to stop bleeding.
en.cuts_and_bleeding_step_3: Clean the wound with clean water.
en.cuts_and_bleeding_step_6: Seek medical help if bleeding doesnâ€™t stop or the cut is deep.
en.choking_step_1: Ask the person if they can speak or cough.
en.choking_step_2: If not, stand behind them and perform abdominal thrusts.
en.choking_step_3: Repeat until the object is expelled.
en.choking_step_4: If they become unconscious, call emergency services and start CPR.
en.heart_attack_step_2: Help the person sit down, keep them calm.
en.heart_attack_step_3: Offer aspirin if theyâ€™re not allergic.
en.heart_attack_step_4: Monitor their breathing and be ready to perform CPR if needed.
en.fractures_step_3: Use a cold pack to reduce swelling.
en.no_steps_available: No steps available for this topic.
